Phones are cellular, and wires are stupid. I can't get my two-year-old to talk on a landline, and I can't keep him away from my cell phone. Partly it's because of the superior design values of telephones, but it's also because they do cooler stuff (No. 2 above). His big sister was three before she really understood that some phones had cords. Her response: "That's dumb, Daddy." Note to telcos: prepare exit strategy from landline business. So young kids interact differently with technologies than even their older brothers and sisters. But they also think differently about media.
